reviews.text: I stayed in the crazy Bear on Friday night and had Suite #6. The room was incredible and i didnt want to leave it with full living area and a huge wet room shower. reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at the CB Italian restaurant last night and were very disappointed. My wide had the prawn starter which was a plate with three prawns on and a tiny bit of garnish. I'm not talking monster prawns - bog standard small to medium sized tiger prawns...absolutely ridiculous for £8.50. My starter of mushrooms in filo pastry (£8.50) was ok. My wife had a main of lamb (£19!) which came as one piece of meat roughly 3" x 1" in size. I had crispy sole fillets (£18.00) which were fine in a Findus kind of way. For dessert we had the tiniest deconstructed tiramisu known to man, and a chocolate bombe filled with ice cream and cherry jam. Each dessert was £9.
reviews.title: Overpriced and undersized

reviews.text: The final bill was £126 which included 3 glasses of wine, and we went home and had some toast because we were still hungry! The dining room wasn't even decorated with the same flourish that CB is renowned for - and the restaurant is in a building over the road from the main hotel. We've enjoyed CB in London for drinks before, but this restaurant is frankly having a laugh. It's incredible that they can sell the most mediocre food at these prices, and then take the p**** even more by giving you child size portions. It's frankly a disgrace given you could spend the same money in all manner of other Italian restaurants (Caldesi in Bray being a great example) and experience skilled cooking and go home full up!

reviews.text: From the moment you walk in u will be overwhelmed by flamboyance this hotel has to be seen to be believed! Our room was a bit dark in the town house so if we go again we would stay in the more grand rooms in the hotel! Food was amazing and the service was excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found out about this hotel using the Living Social deal so did not have a huge expectation when we arrived just looking forward to getting away for the weekend. On arrival, reception was a little hard to find but now understand as it is a listed building so cannot put signs up. Staff were very helpful and showed us to our room, we rang for some extra towels and they came within minutes. The room was small but beautifully done out and clean. Very dark decor which with the lighting did make things difficult to find at times but it was all part of the experience. We had a five course dinner included, offered a great selection which was delicious and the service in the restaurant was fantastic. Service at the bar very slow and waitress forgot our drinks but this was quickly rectified with a free cocktail. Breakfast was an absolute delight, a great selection and good quality, was nice that the complete breakfast menu was included in the deal.
reviews.title: Decor in the bar and restaurant is fantastic, on paper it shouldn't work but it is stunning
